title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Percentage change in retail sales, with a total of 20 data points.
Overall Percentage change in retail sales has increased over the Year.
Percentage change in retail sales is roughly constant from 2000 to 2009, gradually increasing from 2009 to 2010, and lastly roughly constant from 2010 to 2019.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2009 and 2010.
Max Percentage change in retail sales about 6.8 was recorded at Year 2004
Min Percentage change in retail sales about 0.2 was recorded at Year 2009
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Percentage change in retail sales, with a total of 20 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2004 to 2008.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2000 to 2004.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2012 to 2015.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2017 to 2019.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2015 to 2017.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2010 to 2012.
But, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2008 to 2010.
